means: 有创意的，创新的，创造的

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词都可表示"有创造力的"之意。
means: creative ： 侧重指具有把本来不存在的事物创造出来的能力。
original ： 强调具有与众不同，有独到之处的创造能力。
imaginative ： 指想象大异于现实，近乎或等于虚构。强调富有幻想能力。

sentence.Network_en: Some thought must be given to the method of validation.
sentence.Network_cn: 一些想法必须通过验证法加以证实。

sentence.Network_en: For him, the rest of the decade was a creative write-off.
sentence.Network_cn: 对他来说，这个十年所余下的时间是一段创作空白。

sentence.Network_en: Creative people are usually very determined and thrive on overcoming obstacles.
sentence.Network_cn: 富有创造力的人一般都意志非常坚定，能不断克服困难，事业蒸蒸日上。

创新是企业家精神的灵魂。熊彼特关于企业家是从事“创造性破坏（creative destruction）”的创新者观点，凸显了企业家精神的实质和特征。一个企业最大的隐患，就是创新精神的消亡。一个企业，要么.

means.word_mean: 有创造力的,有想像力的

entry.tran: (尤指在艺术方面)有创造力的，有想象力的
entry.def: A creative person has the ability to invent and develop original ideas, especially in the arts.

example.ex: Like so many creative people he was never satisfied.
example.tran: 像许多富于创造力的人一样，他从不满足。
她显而易见的创作才能

entry.def: Creative activities involve the inventing and making of new kinds of things.
If you use something in a creative way, you use it in a new way that produces interesting and unusual results.

example.tran: 他对词语的创造性运用

entry.def: A creative is someone whose job is to be creative, especially someone who creates advertisements.

example.ex: Along with scores of other advertising creatives, he will be taking part in an exhibition at the Saatchi gallery.
example.tran: 他将和许多广告创意人员一起参加在萨奇画廊举行的画展。

means.word_mean: 1. having the ability or power to create;
3. having the power to bring into being

auth_sentence.content: The oft-cited creative differences saw them go separate ways.
auth_sentence.res_content: The oft-cited creative differences saw them go separate ways.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The oft-cited creative differences saw them go separate ways.

auth_sentence.content: BELIEF in numbers has killed creative thinking in science.
auth_sentence.res_content: BELIEF in numbers has killed creative thinking in science.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: BELIEF in numbers has killed creative thinking in science.

auth_sentence.content: Well at this age you could be more creative.
auth_sentence.res_content: Well at this age you could be more creative.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Well at this age you could be more creative.

stems_affixes.word_buile: create[v.创造,创作;引起,造成,建立]+ive……的→adj.有创造力的,创造性的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 生产的, 有生殖力的
stems_affixes.word_buile: procreate[v.生育,繁殖]+ive……的→adj.生产的, 有生殖力的
create[v.创造,创作;引起,造成,建立]+ure表名词→创造物→生物
re重新+crea生长+tion表名词→恢复精力→娱乐,消遣
pro向前+create创造→不断创造,创造很多→生儿育女
re再+create[v.创造,创作;引起,造成,建立]→v.重获创造,再创造

Sentence.sentence: a marvelous product of many creative ideas
Perhaps if we analyze the creative process carefully, we might get some insight into what it is and how it might work in our lives.
The creative process has always been accepted as the source of all important work in the arts, but we should not think the creativity plays a role only in the arts

Applicants are asked to describe an ethical dilemma they've faced and its impact on them, or discuss a public issue of special concern to them, or tell of a fictional character or creative work that has profoundly influenced them.
As a poet, Ted Hughes had an acute sensitivity to the way in which constraints on self-expression, like the disciplines of metre and rhyme (韵律), spur creative thought

means.word_mean: 创造性的, 有创造力的

sentences.en: He is a very creative musician.
sentences.cn: 他是一个非常有创造力的音乐家。

sentences.en: This job is useful and creative.
sentences.cn: 这项工作既有用又富有创造性。

jushi.english: He is a very creative musician.
jushi.chinese: 他是一个非常有创造力的音乐家。

jushi.english: This job is useful and creative.
jushi.chinese: 这项工作既有用又富有创造性。
